summary: This document is a Freedom of Information Act request filed via MuckRock.com on August 13, 2019, seeking all U.S. Marshals Service records concerning Jeffrey Epstein, referencing his death on August 10, 2019. It includes internal USMS email forwarding of the request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Federal prisoner, subject of FOIA request
persons.context: The FOIA request seeks all USMS records concerning Epstein, who is identified as a federal prisoner with Register Number 76318-054 and noted to have died on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: T. McElwee
persons.context: Individual who filed the FOIA request via MuckRock.com seeking USMS records on Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's death reported
events.description: Epstein is widely reported to have died in New York City; the FOIA request references this and includes an attached New York Times article titled 'Jeffrey Epstein Dead in Suicide at Manhattan Jail, Officials Say'.

events.title: FOIA request filed for USMS Epstein records
events.description: T. McElwee files a Freedom of Information Act request via MuckRock.com seeking all U.S. Marshals Service records concerning Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: USMS internal email forwarding FOIA request
events.description: An internal U.S. Marshals Service email forwards the FOIA request about Epstein records, indicating processing within the agency.

locations: Washington, MD 20530-1000 (U.S. Marshals Service FOIA Office address)
New York City (location of Epstein's reported death)
Manhattan Jail (specific location referenced in attached article)
keyFacts: A FOIA request was filed on August 13, 2019, seeking all U.S. Marshals Service records on Jeffrey Epstein, prisoner number 76318-054.
The request references Epstein's reported death on August 10, 2019, in New York City, noting it should affect Privacy Act exemptions.
The requester specifically asks for searches of multiple USMS systems including prisoner tracking, warrant networks, witness security, and internal affairs records.
The request was filed through MuckRock.com by T. McElwee and forwarded internally within USMS on September 12, 2019.
The document shows FOIA processes being initiated shortly after Epstein's death to obtain government records about his case.
